Column Comment.0: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: ABANDONED DATE: the date that this facility was abandoned.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE DATE: The date that the facility became active.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual pieces ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.6: CONSTRUCTED DATE: The date that the facility construction was completed.
Column Comment.7: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. May be used to indicatethe level ofaccuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.8: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.9: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.10: FACILITY DEPTH: The depth of this facility.
Column Comment.12: DESCRIPTION: Short descriptive information about the facility.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.14: ELEVATION: The elevation of this facility.
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.17: FACILITY DIAMETER: the diameter of a facility, such as a pipeline or a tank.
Column Comment.19: FACILITY FUNCTION: A list of valid functions that are satisfied by a facility, such asmeasurement, transportation, processing, storage, separation etc.
Column Comment.20: FACILITY NAME: Name assigned to the facility. This may be the legal or registeredname as it appears on a permit or a given name assigned by the operator.
Column Comment.21: FACILITY NUMBER: the numeric value or code assigned to a piece of equipment.Often this will correspond to the equipment tag number assigned in the productionaccounting system, but this is not required. Could be any numeric value.
Column Comment.22: FACILITY SHORT NAME: Common short name used for the facility.
Column Comment.23: H2S INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this flag is able to handle productscontaining H2S.
Column Comment.24: INACTIVE DATE: date when the facility was decommissioned or became inactive.
Column Comment.25: LAST INJECTION DATE: The date that injection volumes were last reported for thisentity.
Column Comment.26: LAST PRODUCTION DATE: The date that production was last reported for thisentity.
Column Comment.27: LAST REPORTED DATE: The date that a production report was last submitted forthis entity.
Column Comment.28: LATITUDE: Latitude of the facility location.
Column Comment.29: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.30: LONGITUDE: Longitude of the facility location.
Column Comment.31: MANUFACTURED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: the unique identifierfor the business associate who manufactured this facility.
Column Comment.32: ON INJECTION DATE: The date that injection was first reported for this entity.
Column Comment.33: ON PRODUCTION DATE: The date that production was first reported for this entity.
Column Comment.34: PIPELINE MATERIAL: The material that a pipeline is constructed from, such as 24pound steel etc.
Column Comment.35: PIPELINE TYPE: A list of valid types of pipelines.
Column Comment.36: PIPELINE COVER TYPE: A list of valid types of material that covers or surrounds apipeline that is buried below ground level (or sea level).
Column Comment.37: PLOT NAME: Name alias used when plotting the facility on a map.
Column Comment.38: PLOT SYMBOL: A character or symbol used to represent a facility. This may be usedin a particular mapping package coding scheme, or as a pointer to other applicationdependent files.
Column Comment.39: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.40: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field. This is a denormalized columnused only by implementations where facilities service only one field. Where a facilitymay service many fields, the table FACILITY FIELD should be used.
Column Comment.41: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.42: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.43: UNIT OPERATED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that the facility is operatedby through a unit operating agreement.
Column Comment.44: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.45: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.46: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.47: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.48: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.49: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.50: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
